unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Enhanced Quality Control Measures Boost Sector Confidence**
normalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Enhanced Quality Control Measures Boost Sector Confidence**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – The Indian manufacturing sector is witnessing a renewed focus on quality control, driven by rising consumer expectations and stringent export requirements. Leading companies like Tata Steel and Mahindra & Mahindra are investing heavily in advanced inspection technologies and employee training programs.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty sixth, two thousand and twenty three – The Indian manufacturing sector is witnessing a renewed focus on quality control, driven by rising consumer expectations and stringent export requirements. Leading companies like Tata Steel and Mahindra and Mahindra are investing heavily in advanced inspection technologies and employee training programs.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a prominent quality control expert from IIT Delhi, emphasized the importance of Six Sigma methodologies in achieving near-perfect product quality. "Investing in robust quality control processes translates to long-term cost savings and enhanced brand reputation," he stated during a recent industry conference in Chennai.

unnormalised: Recent reports indicate a 15% decrease in product recalls in the last quarter, attributed to the implementation of stricter quality checks at various stages of the supply chain. The government's "Make in India" initiative is also promoting quality standards across the MSME sector, with financial assistance provided for upgrading manufacturing facilities and quality testing labs covering approximately 50,000 sq ft of production space. This initiative aims to reduce defects by 20% and improve the competitiveness of Indian products in the global market, potentially saving the country Rs. 500 Crores annually.
